paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V122I, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Black individuals from the Jackson Heart Study
patients.phenotype: associated with heart failure in the elderly

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The TTR variant (V122I) is present in 3–4% of Black individuals and has been implicated in the pathophysiology of heart failure in the elderly, often unrecognized.

functional_data.summary: The V122I variant is associated with an unknown metabolite and correlates with retinol-binding protein levels.

variants.segregation_data: Not explicitly mentioned in the paper.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with an unknown metabolite (m/z 269.226) and has been confirmed with an authentic standard.
key_quotes: We found the V122I in TTR to be associated with an unknown metabolite (m/z 269.226) in JHS (ß = − 0.76, p value = 4.4E-14).
The TTR tetramer complexes with retinol-binding protein (RBP4).

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was primarily from the results section and included individual records.
